intro: Goniothalamus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate goniothalamus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
